data.title: Campaign takes aim against discrimination in Thailand
data.description: Thai civil society organisations have begun a campaign promoting five recommendations to the government they say would help tackle the discrimination that is still prevalent against vulnerable groups.

data.title: Election Commission's probe into Thaksin carries on
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) will continue to probe former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra

data.title: Alarm over end of Thailand's free medicines policy
data.description: A civil society group is unhappy with the Medical Council of Thailand

data.title: Nine people named in Khao Kradong land dispute petition
data.description: A petition has been submitted to the Central Criminal Court for Corruption and Misconduct Cases against nine people involved in Khao Kradong

data.title: Forest rangers get submachine guns
data.description: The Royal Forest Department has bought locally-made weapons from the Ministry of Defence, saying it was the first time the department has obtained modern submachine guns for the protection of over 32 million rai of the country

data.title: Alarm over end of free meds policy
data.description: A civil society group is unhappy with the Medical Council of Thailand

data.title: Campaign takes aim against discrimination
data.description: Thai civil society organisations have begun a campaign promoting five recommendations to the government they say would help tackle the discrimination that is still prevalent against vulnerable groups.

data.title: Mae Sot's sour trafficking record
data.description: Mae Sot, a town on the Thai-Myanmar border in Tak province, is notorious as a hub for cross-border human trafficking and transnational organised crime run by Chinese mafia syndicates. Despite this, government action has been grossly inadequate to combat the problem.

data.title: EC's probe  into Thaksin  carries on
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) will continue to probe former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra

data.title: Frenchman missing after boat capsizes
data.description: An elderly French tourist went missing on Saturday after his tour boat capsized in strong winds in the reservoir at the Rajjaprabha Dam in Ban Ta Khun district of Surat Thani, local authorities said.

data.title: Hospital tycoon wanted for fraud ‘has fled country’
data.description: The wife and daughter of  Boon Vanasin , the founder of Thonburi Healthcare Group (THG), who remains at large in China, have reportedly surrendered to police in response to warrants issued on charges of public  fraud .

data.title: Officials ready for provincial elections
data.description: The Provincial Administrative Organisation ( PAO ) chairman  elections  in Udon Thani, Phetchaburi and Nakhon Si Thammarat are expected to proceed without any incidents, says the  Election Commission  (EC).

data.title: Lengthy elephant tusks a health concern
data.description: An animal welfare group has expressed concern about the possible trimming of  Plai Sak Surin ’s tusks and whether the  elephant  might be returned to  Sri Lanka  to resume his role as a goodwill ambassador.

data.title: New Koh Kut tourism campaign launched
data.description: TRAT -  Koh Kut  has many interesting beaches to offer that are often overlooked, according to the local Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) office, which has launched a new campaign to promote the island’s attractions during the peak season from now until April.

data.title: Justice sought for teens killed in collision
data.description: More than 50 residents of Umphang village in  Tak  province gathered at a local police station on Saturday to demand justice after two teenagers were killed in a  traffic accident  that they blamed on a deputy district chief.

data.title: 29 illegal migrants found crammed inside pickup box
data.description: PATTANI - Twenty-nine  illegal migrants  from  Myanmar  were found crammed inside an enclosed box in the bed of a pickup truck at a road checkpoint in Sai Buri district of this southern province on Saturday.

data.title: Buddhist monastery ‘using human bodies for meditation’
data.description: Forty-one  cadavers  used in meditation practices at a Buddhist  monastery  in Phichit province are being identified in a police investigation to determine whether they were obtained and used legally.

data.title: Hoping to break its duck
data.description: The drum is rolling once again for the People’s Party (PP), now fired up to win tomorrow’s local election in Udon Thani, a political heartland of the ruling Pheu Thai Party, which it managed to tap into in last year’s general election.

data.title: Council approves big BMA debt fufilment budget
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Council has approved the request by the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration request for a 14.54-billion-baht budget for paying the debt owed to Bangkok Mass Transit System Plc (BTSC), the operator of the BTS Skytrain.

data.title: Singaporean held for making bomb threat against flight
data.description: Authorities have arrested a man holding a Singaporean passport following a  bomb threat  called in against an AirAsia flight departing from Bangkok to Hat Yai.
